text: ever felt like you're running on empty
even when you're doing your best to care
for others do you find yourself
overwhelmed by the emotions of those
around you leaving you feeling
drained and maybe even a little numb
it's easy to think you're just not cut
out for this that maybe you're broken or
selfish but let's set the record
straight feeling emotionally exhausted
doesn't mean you're weak or flawed in
fact it often means you're incredibly
empathetic you care deeply about others
and that's a beautiful thing but if you
constantly absorb the stress and Trauma
around you it can lead to
burnout empathy burnout also known as
compassion fatigue or empathy fatigue
happens when you've absorbed so much of
others emotions that you can't deal with
your own anymore think of it as your
empathy muscles being overworked you're
still the caring compassionate person
you've always has been but right now
you're just exhausted from it with that
said here are some telltale signs you're
suffering from empathy burnout according
to experts a strong sense of
responsibility over others emotions and
suffering do you feel this after a
friend vented to you about their woes
and even though you're not the one going
through it you can't help but feel
overwhelmed and Powerless it's natural
for empathetic people to feel
overwhelmed especially when they carry a
strong sense of respons responsibility
over other people's emotions and
suffering this combination can create a
constant barrage of emotional input
making it feel like you're drowning in
an ocean of other people's
feelings you may feel powerless because
you can't fix everything and that
helplessness can turn into hopelessness
but you don't have to have all the
answers remember even therapists and
counselors trained professionals are
taught not to take on the responsibility
of fixing their clients but to support
them in their Journey trying to solve
everyone's problems on your own can lead
to burnout as it stretches your
emotional resources thin it's okay to
set boundaries and take a step back to
focus on yourself when you need it
feeling emotionally numb or
disconnected normally in an emotional
crisis you're the first one to offer a
shter to cry on but lately you find
yourself struggling to invest the same
amount of time and energy on the
problems of those around you it's not
that you don't care it's that you're
emotionally burnt out it's hard for you
to feel much of anything at all these
days according to psychologist Dr Susan
Alberts this feeling of numbness and
Detachment is both a result of and a
defense mechanism against empathizing
with people too much it's your mind and
body's way of asking you to take a break
and
recharge isolated yourself from
others when you're always taking on
other people's feelings you might find
yourself pulling away from everyone you
may isolate yourself from your friends
and family as a way to protect your
already overtaxed
emotions when you do spend time with
them you may also struggle with relating
to them the way you usually do even
though you're constantly tuned into
others emotions you might find it hard
to relate to them it's like being an
observer rather than a participant in
your own life you might think why can't
I feel the way they do but it's not you
it's the emotional overload talking
feeling angry sad or depressed feeling
angry irritable or sad when you're
always attuned to the needs of feelings
of those around you it's natural to
absorb some of their stress and pain you
might find yourself snapping at loved
ones feeling unusually moody or just
feeling down for no apparent reason this
emotional exhaustion can be closely tied
to what's known as vicarious trauma
vicarious trauma happens when you absorb
the traumatic experiences of others even
if you didn't experience them
firsthand according to therapist Eddie
Nathan when you're constantly exposed to
others suffering your brain can start
reacting as if you're experiencing it
yourself
difficulty sleeping or constant racing
thoughts have you been having trouble
sleeping lately you might find it hard
to fall asleep because your mind won't
stop racing after all empathy burnout
doesn't clock out at bedtime but it's
about other people's problems Global
issues or even just your own worries can
keep you up at night no matter how hard
you try to put it out of your
mind inability to concentrate or be
productive when you're emotionally
exhausted simple tasks can feel
overwhelming you might find it hard to
focus on work or even follow a
conversation it's like your brain is
running on low battery and you struggle
to think clearly make decisions and
complete tasks this can manifest as
difficulty focusing trouble remembering
thing and a general sense of mental
fog empathy burnout isn't a sign of
weakness it's a sign that you've been
strong for for too long constantly
absorbing others emotions without taking
time to recharge can lead to this
emotional exhaustion if any of these
signs resonate with you know that you're
not alone and importantly you're not
broken empathy burnout is a real thing
and it's okay to acknowledge it being a
compassionate person is a beautiful
trait but it's crucial to take care of
yourself too okay experts recommend
setting boundaries prioriti izing
self-care seeking support and
cultivating self-compassion as effective
strategies in restoring your
well-being remember you can't pour from
an empty cup empathy without boundaries
is
self-destruction so fill yours up first
it's not selfish it's
necessary so did this video emotionally
resonate with you share your insights
and experiences in the comments down
below and subscribe to our channel for
more thought-provoking videos on mental
Wellness like how to deal with burnout
and six struggles only genuine empaths
will understand don't forget to like and
share this video before you go thanks
for watching
[Music]
